text:
hi guys welcome to Pai's Thailand food vlog where I 
show you the everyday Thai food culture through

the things that I eat just on a regular basis 
while I'm here so today for lunch having lunch at

home my grandmother made yet another noodle soup 
but today with different noodles we've got some

big hope on noodles as they call it in Chinese or 
these big white rice noodles okay I have a recipe

that shows how to make this and it's just a very 
simple pork broth okay this is some bits of pork

that was used as part of the broth and some pork 
balls put some fried garlic that I made for my

garlic pepper chicken whew great for noodle soups 
and some bean sprouts so that's a simple lunch

and then we're also having some leftovers this 
is fish I know it looks a little mangled but it

used to be a thumb yum fish and we just saved the 
fish and we're just having it with some seafood

dipping sauce for which I also have a recipe the 
best sauce you can possibly have with seafood and

that is our simple lunch for today so for dinner 
today we are having first and foremost Hainanese

chicken rice or tau Mun guy now I believe a lot 
of you know this recipe because I have made a

video for it so this is the rice that's been 
cooked with chicken fat and chicken broth and

then the leftover chicken broth we used to it 
to turn into a soup with some seaweeds so just

to wash down the dryness of the rice and then 
along with that we've got a stir-fry of glass

noodles or Winson with daikon so these are pieces 
of daikon right here and some shrimp and some pork

this and some Chinese celery so this is kind of 
like a my grandma specialty every time I'm here

he always always speaks that and then finally 
a something a little sour and fresh as a palate

cleanser this is a salad of duck egg so my mom got 
some duck eggs and so we are having it so I made

a little dressing with shredded dried shrimp and 
lime and lots of herbs and whatnot in there and

that is our dinner and for dessert we are having 
these little cupcakes well the equivalent of our

cupcakes and they're steamed cakes that are made 
with palm fruit as the yellow color comes from the

husk of the palm fruit and it's a it's the same 
palm that's used to make palm sugar or one of

the palms is used to make palm sugar and it's got 
a very interesting smell very unique normally it

comes also with some coconut on top but the person 
of the market said that the weather is too hot and

the coconuts gonna go bad so they decided to not 
give me any coconut which I was very upset about
